ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Undelete job reports?
ygData.msgSnippet: The jobs directory is only scanned for info about old jobs at startup -- so it won t note your state.job edits unless you quit and restart the Heritrix JVM

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Undelete job reports?

X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

The jobs directory is only scanned for info about old jobs at startup -- 
so it won't note your 'state.job' edits unless you quit and restart the 
Heritrix JVM process. However, I think that will work for you to again 
view your job's reports in the web UI -- it just did in my test.

- Gordon @ IA

stuart_white1 wrote:
> I'm a new Heritrix user, and I'm using Heritrix 1.14.2.  In the web
> gui, I was clicking through the reports (on the Jobs page, under
> Completed Jobs), curious to see what each report provided. 
> Unfortunately, I was careless, and clicked on the last link (Delete)
> before I realized what it was.
> 
> I ssh'ed onto the box, and it appears all of the info for the job is
> still there under $HERITRIX_HOME/jobs.  I see state.job contains the
> word "Deleted".  I tried changing this to be "Finished", but the job
> still does not appear in the web gui.
> 
> Is there a way to undelete a job's reports, so I can view them again
> through the web gui?
> 
> Thanks!
>
